isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - ADJUSTMENTS - CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200i/9400i/9900i MODELS WITH PRO-SLEEPER® AFTER APRIL 2000

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200 i/9400 i/9900 i MODELS WITH PRO-SLEEPER® AFTER APRIL 2000
svcproc.para: Cab air suspension system for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i models with Pro-Sleeper® is set at the factory and should not need adjustment. Cab air suspension ride height is fixed and should be 6 1/2 inches ± 1/16 (165.1 ± 1.6 mm) between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate (Figure 178). If dimension does not meet specified height of 6 1/2 inches ± 1/16 (165.1 ± 1.6 mm) for cab air suspension, adjust as necessary using the following procedure.

figure.caption: Figure 178. Cab Height Measuring Points for Cab air suspension system for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i models with Pro-Sleeper® after April 2000

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 179 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove one end of height control valve linkage (Item 4) from threaded ball pivot (Item 2, Figure 116) by unlatching linkage clip and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot.
Loosen one of the jam nuts (Item 7) and back off the nut several turns.
Turn the height control valve linkage (Item 4) clockwise to shorten the linkage or counterclockwise to lengthen the linkage to adjust the linkage properly.

important.para: There must be a minimum of 5 full threads engaged between the threaded rod and the linkage socket. If a longer valve linkage is required, contact Link Manufacturing customer service for assistance.

figure.caption: Figure 179. Cab Air Suspension Height Control for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i models with Pro-Sleeper® after April 2000

step1.para: Reconnect height control valve linkage (Item 4) onto threaded ball pivot (Item 2, Figure 116) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place.
Re-measure the cab ride height, if necessary, continue to make adjustments until proper cab ride height is obtained.
When the height control valve linkage (Item 4) is properly adjusted, latch the linkage clip and tighten jam nut (Item 7). Tighten to Hand tight + 1/8 turn.
